data.text: Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,
As
When thou didst terrible things
For since the beginning of the world
Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness,
But we are all as an unclean
And
But now, O
¶ Be not wroth very sore, O
Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.
Wilt thou refrain thyself for these
